content.question: A cart of mass <math alttext="2.0 kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> on a horizontal surface is attached to a horizontal spring of negligible mass. The other end of the spring is attached to a wall, and there is negligible friction between the cart-block-spring system and the horizontal surface. The cart-block-spring system then experiences simple harmonic motion as described by the graph that shows the velocity of the cart-block system as a function of time.
